name: CommandManager
description: Manages client-side commands in JsMacros, providing functionality to create, register, unregister, and manage custom commands. This class serves as the central point for command registration and handling, supporting both Fabric and Forge mod loaders.
overview: The CommandManager is accessible via the Chat API and allows script developers to create sophisticated custom commands with argument parsing, auto-completion, and execution handling.

methods.name: getValidCommands
methods.description: Returns a list of all currently registered client-side commands.

methods.name: createCommandBuilder
methods.description: Creates a new CommandBuilder for defining a custom command with arguments and execution logic.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the command to create

methods.name: unregisterCommand
methods.description: Removes a command from the command registry, allowing it to be re-registered later if needed.

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: The name of the command to unregister

methods.name: reRegisterCommand
methods.description: Re-registers a previously unregistered command node back into the command system.

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: The command node to re-register (obtained from `unregisterCommand()`)

methods.name: getArgumentAutocompleteOptions
methods.description: Asynchronously retrieves argument autocomplete suggestions for a given partial command input.

parameters.name: commandPart
parameters.description: The partial command to get suggestions for

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A callback function that receives the list of suggestions
